thread.title: ONDO: Police foil 13 factional lawmakers’ attempt to occupy chambers
thread.title_full: ONDO: Police foil 13 factional lawmakers’ attempt to occupy chambers

author: Nwafor Polycarp
title: ONDO: Police foil 13 factional lawmakers’ attempt to occupy chambers
text:
Home » News » ONDO: Police foil 13 factional lawmakers’ attempt to occupy chambers ONDO: Police foil 13 factional lawmakers’ attempt to occupy chambers On 3:21 am In News by Nwafor Polycarp Comments 
By Dayo Johnson 
Akure—ATTEMPT by a faction of the troubled members of the Ondo state House of Assembly to forcefully occupy the chambers was foiled yesterday by police detectives. 
The warring 26members have been at loggerheads over the speakership of the assembly in the last two months. 
Consequently, security has been beefed up at the Assembly following a plot by the 13 lawmakers loyal to Malachi Coker to hold a session despite a contrary directive by the governor, Rotimi Akeredolu SAN. Nigerian Police 
Akeredolu had intervened by meeting separately with the two factions emphasising the need for genuine reconciliation. 
Information reportedly filtered to the other 13 lawmakers led by the Speaker Jumoke Akindele and they also mobilized to storm the chambers. 
Security report of a possible break down of law and order reached the governor who directed the Police commissioner, Hilda Harrison, to foil the attempt and beef up security at the assembly. 
Unknown to the Malachi faction, on getting to the assembly, they reportedly met police resistance. 
Meanwhile, the Akindele faction has withdrawn its case challenging her sack, from High Court, Akure, as part of the reconciliation move by the governor. Nwafor Polycarp
